vulnerabilities.description: Origin advertises HTTP/2 (h2) via ALPN; ensure HTTP/2-specific hardening (HPACK/DoS controls, reverse-proxy config).
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review HTTP/2 configuration at the edge (WAF/CDN/proxy), apply rate limits, and keep TLS stack updated.

vulnerabilities.description: DOM-based Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) detected via DOM manipulation
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Avoid using dangerous DOM sinks with user-controlled data; use safe DOM APIs and validate input
vulnerabilities.background: DOM-based XSS vulnerabilities occur when the DOM is modified in an unsafe way using untrusted data from sources like location.hash or document.URL.
vulnerabilities.impact: DOM-based XSS is particularly dangerous as it bypasses server-side protections. Attackers can execute arbitrary JavaScript in the victim's browser context.
